i have read many accounts that state evp sessions work better when you are =
clear and focused. ( meditative) =A0I dont think it matters who you ask for=
- its your preferences, ( in my opinion)- if you want to talk to a departed=
 loved one, it is fine to ask for them, but if they dont show up right away=
 dont be discouraged. Also, in my own personal experience, If you ask for '=
just anybody'=A0 then that is exactly who youll get! ( lol)
=A0
=A0
=A0Also=
, on a more personal and less itc note-
=A0sorry to the group that i havent=
 been posting. I am at the start of a big family move and we dont even have=
 a new place to go yet- so the stress is at all-time high levels....
( we a=
re finally giving up as the drug lords in the upstairs half of our house ha=
ve ruined this home for us.)
=A0
Also- I am feeling a bit of a loss here...=
 even tho it is partially (if not all) selfish.
Monique ( one of my long-ti=
me spirit frineds) to my understanding has moved on and gone to the light. =
Although this is excellent news for Monique, I DO feel the lack of her pres=
ence around me, as she had been here nearly 17 years (=A0at least thats wha=
t she=A0told me)
Anyway.... It feels like i lost a dear friend.... 
She was=
 quite an excellent chatter and never even needed a riado or manual sweep t=
o leave clear evps for me. I hate to say it but i was sorry to see her go.
=
=A0( i know, selfish me )
anyways- i am keeping tabs on all=A0your posts, g=
lad to see the new members,=A0and as soon as i get my family into a new hom=
e i will get back into the research that i love so dearly.
My apologies for=
 not participating in the research at this time.
Charm
=A0


--- On Thu, 6/=
26/08, earthangel5998 <harris5998@...> wrote:

From: earthangel5998 =

o: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com

=

Also...

Is there any way to "prepare" for recording like light a candle, =

meditate, etc? I am thinking maybe when I start sessions I can light a 
ca=
ndle and when I end them I can blow the candle out kind of like a 
signal.
=

My grandfather- in-law and my father-in-law have both passed, should I 
tr=
y and ask for them by name or should I ask for anyone available? 

Sorry fo=
r the questions, I've never done this before! 

Thanks! 
Angela

<table cellspacing='0' cellpadding='0' border='0' ><tr><td valign='top' style='font: inherit;'><P><STRONG><FONT color=#7f007f>i have read many accounts that state evp sessions work better when you are clear and focused. ( meditative)  I dont think it matters who you ask for- its your preferences, ( in my opinion)- if you want to talk to a departed loved one, it is fine to ask for them, but if they dont show up right away dont be discouraged. Also, in my own personal experience, If you ask for 'just anybody'  then that is exactly who youll get! ( lol)</FONT></STRONG></P>
<P><STRONG><FONT color=#7f007f></FONT></STRONG> </P>
<P><STRONG><FONT color=#7f007f></FONT></STRONG> </P>
<P><STRONG><FONT color=#7f007f> Also, on a more personal and less itc note-</FONT></STRONG></P>
<P><STRONG><FONT color=#7f007f> sorry to the group that i havent been posting. I am at the start of a big family move and we dont even have a new place to go yet- so the stress is at all-time high levels....</FONT></STRONG></P>
<P><STRONG><FONT color=#7f007f>( we are finally giving up as the drug lords in the upstairs half of our house have ruined this home for us.)</FONT></STRONG></P>

<P><STRONG><FONT color=#7f007f>Also- I am feeling a bit of a loss here... even tho it is partially (if not all) selfish.</FONT></STRONG></P>
<P><STRONG><FONT color=#7f007f>Monique ( one of my long-time spirit frineds) to my understanding has moved on and gone to the light. Although this is excellent news for Monique, I DO feel the lack of her presence around me, as she had been here nearly 17 years ( at least thats what she told me)</FONT></STRONG></P>
<P><STRONG><FONT color=#7f007f>Anyway.... It feels like i lost a dear friend.... </FONT></STRONG></P>
<P><STRONG><FONT color=#7f007f>She was quite an excellent chatter and never even needed a riado or manual sweep to leave clear evps for me. I hate to say it but i was sorry to see her go.</FONT></STRONG></P>

<P><STRONG><FONT color=#7f007f>anyways- i am keeping tabs on all your posts, glad to see the new members, and as soon as i get my family into a new home i will get back into the research that i love so dearly.</FONT></STRONG></P>
<P><STRONG><FONT color=#7f007f>My apologies for not participating in the research at this time.</FONT></STRONG></P>
